TextView.android:text: If you think that weights are the only way to develop a good back ? Think again. You can build your back – without lifting a single barbell or dumbbell. You don't need the gym for an effective back workout, which is welcome news with the coronavirus pandemic ongoing.

Moving your limbs away from your core makes this exercise for back fat an abs workout and balance challenge , too.


	a)Start in a straight-arm plank with hands below and in line with shoulders, feet slightly wider than hip-width apart.
b)Keeping hips as still as possible, lift one arm up to shoulder height.
	c)Return to center, then lift the other arm to shoulder height. (Draw belly button up and in and keep your body centered.)

Rather than cranking out hundreds of reps, incorporate more isometric back exercises in your at-home workout to help build muscle.


	a)Start in pushup position with hands slightly wider than shoulder width, feet hip-width apart. Your body should form a straight line from heels to head.
	b)Bend elbows and lower body until hovering a few inches above the ground. Hold for 1 deep breath, and then press half-way up and hold for 1 deep breath.
	c)Lower back down to your lowest point, holding for 1 deep breath.
	d)Return to your half-way point for one more hold.
	Do 5 reps.

a)Lay flat on your stomach. Lift your chest up, arching your back and interlacing your hands behind your back.
	b)Lift your hands and legs up, touching your heels together.
	c)Slowly move your legs apart and bring them back together.
	Do 20 reps.

Time for a round of twister—but in the form of an at-home back exercise. This chair pose will stretch and strengthen your back while the rotations will hit your obliques.


	a)Squat into chair position with hands in prayer pose in front of chest.
	b)Twist your torso to the right while remaining in chair pose, and place the left elbow on the outside of the right knee. The other elbow should be pointing to the ceiling./n	c)Hold for three breaths, then return to center. Repeat on the other side.
	Do 4 reps.

a)Start in push-up position and bend one leg behind you so the bottom of the foot is facing toward the ceiling.
	Lower your body to the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your back straight.
	b)Push yourself back up.
	Do 10 reps per side.
